SPECIFICATION FOR
CAST IRON DETACHABLE JOINTS FOR USE
WITH ASBESTOS’ CEMENT PRESSURE PIPES

MANAK
BHAVAN,
9 BAHADUR
SHAH ZAFAR
MARG
NEW DELHI
110002

rs:8794-1988
Indian Standard
SPECIFICATION FOR
CAST IRON DETACHABLE JOINTS FOR USE
WITH ASBESTOS CEMENT PRESSURE PIPES

resist
end thrust, and it is essential to adequately
anchor end caps and bends.

0.1 The Indian Standard
( First
Revision ) was
adopted
by the Bureau
of Indian Standards on
5 August 1988, after the draft finalized by the Pig
Iron
and Cast Iron Sectional
Committee
had
been approved
by the
Structural
and Metals
Division Council.

0.4 For bolts and nuts to be used for these joints,
a reference
to
IS  :  1363 (Part
l)-1984”
and
IS  :  1363 (Part 3)-1984* may be made.

For rubber rings to be used for these joints,
a reference to IS  :  10292-1988t may be made.

0.2 This standard
was first published
in 1978
covering
the requirements
of cast iron detach-
able
joints
to be used with asbestos
cement
pressure
pipes
conforming
to
IS  :  1592-1970.
With the revision of IS  :  1592 in 1980, a need
was felt to revise this standard in order to match
with
the requirements
of IS  :  1592-1980*.
In
this revision,
apart
from this aspect, joints
of
classes 20 and 25, and sizes up to 600 mm have
been added.

0.5 For
the
purpose
of deciding
whether
a
particular
requirement
of
this
standard
is
complied
with, the
final
value, observed
or
calculated;
expressing
the
result
of a test or
analysis, shall be rounded off in accordance
with
IS  :  2-1960f.
The number
of significant places
retained in the rounded off value should be the
same
as that
of the
specified
value
in
this
standard.

0.3 Detachable joint comprises a cast iron centre
collar
and two flanges, together with two rubber
rings. The assembly is bolted together.
It should
be noted
that the joints
are not intended
to

of product
Grade C  :  Part I Hexagon  head bolts (  size
range M 5 to M 36 ) (  second
revision ),  and Part 3
Hexagon
nuts
(size
range  M  1.6
to M 36) (second
revision ).

requirements
fo< rubber
sealing rings
for CID joints in asbestos cement piping (  first revision ).
$Rules for rounding
off numerical values (  revised ).

*Specification for asbestos cement  pressure
pipes
(  second revision  ) .

3.2 The varigus parts of detachable
joints shall
be stripped
with all precautions
necessary
to
avoid warping or shrinking
defects. They shall
be free from defects other than any unavoidable
surface
imperfections
which results from
the
method
of manufacture
and which do not affect
the use of joints.
By agreement
between
the
purchaser and the manufacturer,
minor
defects
may be rectified.

1.1  This standard
covers
the requirements
for
cast
iron
detachable
joints to be used with
asbestos cement
pressure
pipes conforming
to
IS  :  1592-1980*.

2.1 The general
requirements
relating
to the
supply of material
shall be as laid down in
IS  :  1387-19677.

3.3 The joints shall be such that they
could be
cut, drilled or machined.
In case of dispute, the
castings may be accepted provided the hardness
measured
on the external
unmachined
surface
does
not exceed the Brine11 hardness
of 215
HBS.

3.1 The
metal
used
for the manufacture
of
joints shall be of requisite
quality
conforming
to any of the grade of IS  :  210-1978:.

*Specification  for
asbestos
cement
pressure
pipes
(  second revision ).
$General
requirements
for the supply of metallurgical
materials
(  first revisbn ).
3Specification
for grey iron castings  (third revision).

4.0 Mechanical tests shall be carried
out during
manufacture
and at the most twice per day of
castings.
The
results
obtained
are taken to
joints of all sizes made during

6.1 Dimensions
for the cast iron
flanges and
collars shall confprm
to Table
1 and Table 2
respectively
for the nominal
dia, DN and class
specified.

-
Two tensile tests shall be
made on bars cast from the same metal in a-r-
dance with the method specified in Appendix
A.
The results of the tests shall show a minimum
tensile strength of 150 MPa (15 kgF/mmz).

NOTE 1 -
Nominal
diameter
of detachable
joints
shall refer to the corresponding nominal diameter of
the asbestos cement pressure pipes.
NOTE 2 -
Cast
iron detachable
joints of ndminal
diameter
more than 600 mm may also be manufactur-
ed.
In  such cases, detailed dimensions and tolerances
may be as mutually agreed between the purchaser
and the supplier.

4.2  Brine11 Hardness
Tests -
For checking the
Brine11 hardness specified in 4.3, Brine11 hardness
tests shall be carried
out on the test bars used
for tests in 5.1.
The test shall be carried out in
accordance
with IS  :  1500-1983*.

6.2 Diameter and length of bolts to be used with
cast iron flanges shall be as given in Table 3.

4.3  Retest L  If any test piece representing
a lot
fails to pass the test in the first instance, two
additional tests shall be made on test pieces made
from the metal used from the same lot. Should
either
of these additional test pieces fail to pass
the test, the lot shall be deemed as not comply-
ing with the standard.

6.3 Approximate
mass of joints (excluding rubber
rings and bolts), calculated by taking the density
of cast iron as 7.15 kg/cm3 has been given in
Table 4 for information.

6.4 The diameter
of engagement
end of joints
shall match
the corresponding
outside diameter
of asbestos cement pressure pipes of appropriate
classes conforming to IS  :  1592-1980*.

5.1 Hydrostatic
test
shall be carried
out for
collars only.
For this test, the collar shall be
kept under pressure for 15 seconds,
minimum;
it may be struck moderately
with a 700 g ham-
mer.
It should withstand the pressure test w;th-
out showing
any leakage
or sweating or other
defects of any kind.
The hydrostatic test as far
as possible shall be conducted before coating the
collar.

7.1 The tolerances
on the various
dimensions
shall be as follows  :

Wall thickness of
collar
-(l
+ 0.05 t) (see Note)

5.1.1  The collar
shall withstand the test pres-
sure specified in Table 1 of IS  :  1592-l 980f for
the class of asbestos cement pressure
pipes with
which they are to be used.
When collars are
required for higher pressures, the test pressures
are subject
to special agreement
between
the
purchaser and the manufacturer.

with the same
material,
the parts
being pre-
heated
prior
to total
immersion in a bath con-
taining
a uniformly heated composition
having a
bituminous tar or other suitable base.

NOTE -  For joints used for carrying potable water,
coal tar should not be used.

8.2.1 Alternatively,
the coating
on the
cast
iron parts may be done without preheating
with
two coats of black Japan conforming
to Type
c of IS  :  341-1973*, if agreed at the time of
enquiry and order.

OF BOLTS

8.3 The coating
material
shall set rapidly with
good adherence and shall not scale off.

8.4 In all instances
where the coating material
has a tar or similar base, it shall be smooth
and
tenacious,
and hard enough
not to flow when
exposed
to a temperature
of 65°C but not so
brittle
at a temperature
of 0°C as to chip off
when scribed lightly with a penknife.

8.5 When the parts
are to be used for convey-
ing pl>table water,
the inside coating
shall not
contain
any constituent
soluble in such water or
any ingredient
which could impart any taste or
odour
whatsoever
to the potable
water
after
sterilization and suitably washing of the mains.

8.6 In case of parts (wholly or partially
coated)
which is imperfectly coated or where the coating
does not set or conform to the yuality
specified
in 8.1 to 8.5, the coating shall be removed
and
the parts re-coated.

MASSOFJOINT(  APPROXIMATE,EXCLUDING
RUBBER KINQ AND BOLTS)
IN kg FOR  CLASS

9.1 The requirements
for sampling and criteria
for conformity
shall be as given in Appendix B.

10.1 Each joint
shall have cast,
stamped
or
indelibly_painted
on it the following appropriate
inarks:
a>

Last two digits for the year of manufac-
ture; and

Any other
mark, if-required by the pur-
chaser.

8.0 After
inspection,\
each part of joint shall be
coated as specified in ‘3.1 to 8.6.

11.1 The material may also be marked with the
Standard
Mark.
The details are available with
the Bureau of Indian Standards.

8.1 Coating
shall not be applied
to any part
unless its surface is clean, dry and free from rust.

8.2 Unless
otherwise
agreed
to between
the

parts
shall be coated

These joints/collars

requirement

rubber rings and bolts), calculated by taking

on specified mass of joints shall be r 8 percent’  .
